shortDescription: Technical Manager for HM ecommerce websites in 5 different countries. Managed all technical communications and specifications with vendors external clients and internal design teams. 2024
projectDescription:
As a Technical Manager for HM in 5 different countries I was responsible for ensuring all technical aspects of the websites were up to date and functioning correctly. 

 This included managing a team of developers, overseeing the development process, and dealing directly with multiple stakeholders to ensure the project met the client's requirements. 

 My role involved coordinating with the design team to implement new features, optimize performance, and ensure the site's security. I also provided technical support and guidance to the development team, ensuring that the project adhered to best practices and industry standards.

shortDescription: First VtexIO website for Ecomsur. Introduced use of GIT and React technologies to the entire Front End division as a SR Front End developer. 2020 - 2023
projectDescription:
As a Senior Front End Developer, I led the development of the first VtexIO-powered website for Ecomsur from 2020 to 2023.

 This project marked a significant shift in our technical strategy, as I introduced and integrated the use of GIT and React technologies to the entire Front End division. By leveraging VtexIO, I was able to build a robust e-commerce platform that elevated our client's capabilities. 

The adoption of React enhanced the user interface, making it more interactive and dynamic, while GIT allowed for more efficient version control and collaboration across the development team.

shortDescription: Developed the Front End for the entire LatAm ecommerce market for Pandora. Included two complete redesigns of the website simultaneously done in 5 countries. 2020 - 2024
projectDescription:
From 2020 to 2024, I spearheaded the development of the Front End for Pandora's entire LatAm e-commerce market. 

 This endeavor included undertaking two comprehensive redesigns of the website, which were simultaneously implemented across five different countries. The project demanded a nuanced understanding of both global brand consistency and local market nuances to ensure a seamless and unified user experience. The redesigns involved modernizing the design aesthetics, improving user navigation, and optimizing performance across different devices to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates throughout the region.

As a Technical Manager from 2023 to 2024, I singlehandedly designed and developed of an innovative platform designed to manage our extensive front end infrastructure, spanning over 2400 repositories.

  This platform facilitates real-time tracking of releases, streamlines codebase component searches, and enables tagging and cataloging of components for enhanced reusability. 

 Built with Next.js for robust front-end capabilities, GraphQL for efficient data querying, and Strapi for flexible content management, the platform is deployed on Azure Web Apps to ensure scalability and reliability. This tool significantly boosted productivity and provided the team with a centralized, user-friendly interface to manage and optimize front-end assets.
shortDescription: Sole developer for a platform to help manage infrastructure and releases for more then 2400 repositories in over 120 different active projects. 2023-2024

projectDescription:
This project involved developing a comprehensive website for a psychologist in MÃ©rida using Next.js and Strapi as a CMS for storing all the data.

 The site features static rendering for improved SEO and performance, enabling fast load times and enhanced search engine visibility. I conducted a custom UI/UX design using Figma that reflects the Clients professionalism and warmth. Additionally, I handled all the photography to ensure the visuals align with the design and content, providing an authentic and inviting online presence. 

The website has been an effective tool for client engagement and practice growth since its launch in 2019.
shortDescription: Custom design and development for a psychologist in Merida, Yucatan MX. 2018 - current
Personal portfolio built with NextJs to showcase my work and skills. NextJS, RadixUI, Custom CSS - 2024
projectDescription: Completely custom made website from scratch to showcase my work and skills. I used NextJS for the front end with RadixUI for a headless CMS. All styling was done with CSS to keep the site as light as possible. Design credit to Yanka Deralova. 2024

shortDescription: Led team of 3 developers to build the first VtexIO website for Vans in Mexico. Including House of Vans Streaming Service 2020 - 2023
projectDescription:
As a Senior Front End Developer, I led a team of three developers in building the first VtexIO website for Vans in Mexico from 2020 to 2023. 

 This project was a significant milestone for the company, as it marked our first foray into using NodeJS services to incorporate House of Vans live streaming service and schedule from their private API. I was responsible for overseeing the development process, ensuring that the site met the client's requirements and adhered to best practices. 

 The website featured a modern and dynamic design, optimized for performance and user experience. By leveraging VtexIO's capabilities, we were able to deliver a robust e-commerce platform that enhanced Vans' online presence and customer engagement.
